ARABIC: فَتِلْكَ بُيُوتُهُمْ خَاوِيَةًۢ بِمَا ظَلَمُوٓا۟ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَءَايَةً لِّقَوْمٍ يَعْلَمُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: These are the ruins of their houses because of the wrong they did. There is certainly a Sign in that for people with knowledge.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: So these their habitations lie deserted now because of their iniquities. Verily there is a sign in this for those who understand.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Now behold their houses that lie in utter ruins because of their wrong-doing. Verily there is a Sign in this for the people who know.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Those are their empty houses which We ruined because of their injustice. In this there is evidence (of the truth) for the people of knowledge.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: So these are their houses fallen flat, the recompense of their injustice; indeed in this is a sign for people who know.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: These are their houses in utter ruin, for they did wrong. Verily, in this is indeed an Ayah for people who know.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: So those are their houses fallen down because they were unjust, most surely there is a sign in this for a people who know.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Those are their houses, all fallen down because of the evil they committed; surely in that is a sign for a people who have knowledge.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: See, yonder are their dwellings empty and in ruins because they did wrong. Lo! herein is indeed a portent for a people who have knowledge.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Because of their wrongdoing, their houses are in ruins, in that surely there is a sign for people who have knowledge,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: So yonder are their houses overturned, for they did wrong. Verily, herein is a sign unto a people who know.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: So there lay their houses, fallen in ruin because of their wrongdoing. There is indeed a sign in that for a people who have knowledge.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Now such were their houses, - in utter ruin, - because they practised wrong-doing. Verily in this is a Sign for people of knowledge.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: These are their houses in utter ruin, for they did wrong. Verily, in this is indeed an Ayah (a lesson or a sign) for people who know.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Those are their houses, all are in ruins because of the evil they committed; surely in this there is a sign for nation who know.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Here are their homes, in ruins, on account of their iniquities. Surely in this is a sign for people who know.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: So those are their houses, desolate because of the wrong they had done. Indeed in that is a sign for people who know.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [27:52] So those then are their houses [lying] deserted (khāwiyatan is in the accusative because it is a circumstantial qualifier, the operator of which is the import of the demonstrative pronoun [tilka, ‘those’]) because of the evil which they did, that is, their disbelief. Surely in that there is a sign, a lesson, for a people who have knowledge, of Our power and are thus admonished.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (See, yonder are their dwellings empty and in ruins because they did wrong) because of their idolatry. (Lo! Herein) in that which We did to them (is indeed a portent) a sign and an admonition (for a people who have knowledge) who believe in that which was done to them.
